文献ID: STP1505-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_15th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: Historically, zirconium alloys were chosen as structural materials for water reactors because of the combination of low thermal neutron capture cross section, relatively high mechanical strength and high corrosion resistance in water and steam at elevated temperatures.

文献ID: STP1505-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_15th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: Historically, zirconium alloys were chosen as structural materials for water reactors because of the combination of low thermal neutron capture cross section, relatively high mechanical strength and high corrosion resistance in water and steam at elevated temperatures.

文献ID: STP1505-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_15th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: Pure zirconium can not be used in water reactors due to its low strength and low corrosion resistance in water environments.

文献ID: STP1505-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_15th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: At this point in time the increased cladding corrosion observed in high temperature Pressurized Water Reactors (PWRs) encouraged the fuel vendors to develop more corrosion resistant materials which were verifie in co-operation with utilities.
